channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Building waste and furniture left on alleyway near Lessnes Abbey Wood., 12th November
item.description:
There is building waste, some asbestos and furniture dumped on the alleyway behind Elstree Gardens in Belvedere, DA 17 5DW. Has been there more than a month now.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elstree Gardens, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wooden pallet left, 12th November
item.description:
Been there for 2 weeks on the pavement opposite number 22, 24 , 26 Straightsmouth
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Straightsmouth, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Messy repair to protruding manhole, 12th November
item.description:
Not wanting to sound like Victor Meldrew, but the repair to the protruding manhole cover I reported yesterday has been carried out in a disappointingly careless manner. I would strongly urge you to ask BT to return and complete the job properly. The manhole should have been correctly reseated and finished with sand and cement, rather than having a hasty patch of tarmac applied around it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cromwell Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Paint, 12th November
item.description:
Someone has spilt white paint all over the pavement

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): East Street, Plaistow, London

item.title: Pavement closed both sides of road, 12th November
item.description:
Pavement and road closed. No access for pedestrians. Diversion not obvious and too long a route.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 65, Elizabeth Street, Belgravia, London

item.title: New litter bin needed, 12th November
item.description:
There is always a lot of litter outside of St Paul’s sports ground. Could we get a new litter bin there so that the lazy people who don’t want to take their litter to the nearest bin may be inclined to use one if it is right in front of them instead?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Salter Road, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bikes blocking pavement, 12th November
item.description:
There are lime bikes blocking pavement and cycle stand outside the Portman Square Garden opposite to 12-14 Portman Square. The bikes need to be maintained to minimise potential hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12-14, Portman Square, Marylebone, London

item.title: Debris and bricks, 12th November
item.description:
Yesterday a car smashed through the front window of resident maisonette, their front wall and green box and alot of debris are on the footway and in her garden along with the window frame etc, would the council be able to assist in clearing all the debris bricks etc from the accident
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 91,93, Woodside Lane, Blendon, London

item.title: Street not cleaned for months, 12th November
item.description:
The build up of leaves and rubbish is so bad that yellow lines and parking lines are obscured. In wet weather it makes the streets slippery. Some residents have bagged up leaves but these have not been collected.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crescent Lane, Clapham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Garnham Close, Hackney, London

item.title: Five bars of leaves collected by residents on the pavement adjacent to the green opposite No21 Regent Square Belvedere DA17 6EP, 12th November
item.description:
Five Bags of leaves collected by Regent Square Residents have been left on the pavement adjacent to the green opposite No19 Regent Square. Would arrangements be put in place to collect the bags of leaves as soon as practical.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Regent Square, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A number of Black Bags discarded on the roadside. Broken glasss, Empty bottles and general rubbish on pavement., 12th November
item.description:
Approximately 6 Black Bags Fly tipped on the side of Ancona Road in close proximity to the school entrance. Ancona Road has not been swept for a number of weeks. Broken bottles, empty bottles, general rubbish discarded on the road. It looks really unsightly. If this can be addressed as soon as possible.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Charlton Park Road, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet
